member.summary: Gradient definition; corresponds to the Centered option on the Gradient Tab of the Boundary Hatch and Fill dialog box. Each gradient has two definitions, shifted and non-shifted. A Shift value describes the blend of the two definitions that should be used. A value of 0.0 means only the non-shifted version should be used, and a value of 1.0 means that only the shifted version should be used.

The DWG file format uses a modification of a standard cyclic redundancy check as an error detecting mechanism.
This class checks the integrity of the file using this check.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.PostFix
member.summary: Specifies a text prefix or suffix (or both) to the dimension measurement (see DIMPOST System Variable).

remarks.para: For example, to establish a suffix for millimeters, set PostFix to mm; a distance of 19.2 units would be displayed as 19.2 mm.
If tolerances are turned on, the suffix is applied to the tolerances as well as to the main dimension.

Use <> to indicate placement of the text in relation to the dimension value. For example, enter <> mm to display a 5.0 millimeter radial dimension as "5.0mm". If you entered mm <>, the dimension would be displayed as "mm 5.0". Use the <> mechanism for angular dimensions.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.AlternateDimensioningSuffix
member.summary: Specifies a text prefix or suffix (or both) to the alternate dimension measurement for all types of dimensions except angular (see DIMAPOST System Variable).

remarks.para: For instance, if the current units are Architectural, is on (true), is 25.4 (the number of millimeters per inch), is 2, and AlternateDimensioningSuffix is set to "mm", a distance of 10 units would be displayed as 10"[254.00mm].
To turn off an established prefix or suffix (or both), set it to a single period (.).

member.remarks: Setting GenerateTolerances to on (true) turns off (false).

member.remarks: Setting LimitsGeneration to on (true) turns off (false).

member.value: true if the second extension line is to be suppressed; otherwise false.

member.summary: Controls the display of alternate units in dimensions (see DIMALT System Variable).
member.value: true enables alternate units; false disables alternate units.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.AlternateUnitDecimalPlaces
member.summary: Controls the number of decimal places in alternate units (see DIMALTD System Variable).
member.remarks: If is turned on (true), AlternateUnitDecimalPlaces specifies the number of digits displayed to the right of the decimal point in the alternate measurement.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextOutsideExtensions
member.summary: Controls whether a dimension line is drawn between the extension lines even when the text is placed outside. (see DIMTOFL System Variable).
member.remarks: For radius and diameter dimensions, a dimension line is drawn inside the circle or arc when the text, arrowheads, and leader are placed outside.

value.para: true: Draws dimension lines between the measured points even when arrowheads are placed outside the measured points
false: Does not draw dimension lines between the measured points when arrowheads are placed outside the measured points

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.SeparateArrowBlocks
member.summary: Controls the display of dimension line arrowhead blocks (see DIMSAH System Variable).

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextInsideExtensions
member.summary: Draws text between extension lines (see DIMTIX System Variable).

value.para: false: For linear and angular dimensions, dimension text is placed inside the extension lines if there is sufficient room.

true: Draws dimension text between the extension lines even if it would ordinarily be placed outside those lines. For radius and diameter dimensions, TextInsideExtensions on (true) always forces the dimension text outside the circle or arc.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.SuppressOutsideExtensions
member.summary: Suppresses arrowheads if not enough space is available inside the extension lines (see DIMSOXD System Variable).
member.value: true if arrowheads are to be suppressed; otherwise, false.

0-8: Specifies the number of decimal places displayed in angular dimensions (independent of the value of the property).

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the overall scale factor applied to dimensioning variables that specify sizes, distances, or offsets (see DIMSCALE System Variable).

remarks.para: This ScaleFactor does not affect measured lengths, coordinates, or angles.

Use ScaleFactor to control the overall scale of dimensions. However, if the current dimension style is annotative, ScaleFactor is automatically set to zero and the dimension scale is controlled by the CANNOSCALE system variable. ScaleFactor cannot be set to a non-zero value when using annotative dimensions.
Also affects the leader objects with the LEADER command.
Use MLEADERSCALE to scale multileader objects created with the MLEADER command.

value.para: A reasonable default value is computed based on the scaling between the current model space viewport and paper space. If you are in paper space or model space and not using the paper space feature, the scale factor is 1.0.
A scale factor is computed that leads text sizes, arrowhead sizes, and other scaled distances to plot at their face values.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.ArrowSize
member.summary: Controls the size of dimension line and leader line arrowheads. Also controls the size of hook lines (see DIMASZ System Variable).

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtensionLineOffset
member.summary: Specifies how far extension lines are offset from origin points (see DIMEXO System Variable).
member.remarks: With fixed-length extension lines, this value determines the minimum offset.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimensionLineIncrement
member.summary: Controls the spacing of the dimension lines in baseline dimensions (see DIMDLI System Variable).
member.remarks: Each dimension line is offset from the previous one by this amount, if necessary, to avoid drawing over it. Changes made with DimensionLineIncrement are not applied to existing dimensions.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtensionLineExtension
member.summary: Specifies how far to extend the extension line beyond the dimension line (see DIMEXE System Variable).

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.Rounding
member.summary: Rounds all dimensioning distances to the specified value (see DIMRND System Variable).

remarks.para: For instance, if Rounding is set to 0.25, all distances round to the nearest 0.25 unit. If you set the value to 1.0, all distances round to the nearest integer.
Note that the number of digits edited after the decimal point depends on the precision set by .
This does not apply to angular dimensions.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimensionLineExtension
member.summary: Sets the distance the dimension line extends beyond the extension line when oblique strokes are drawn instead of arrowheads. (see DIMDLE System Variable).

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.PlusTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum (or upper) tolerance limit for dimension text when or is on (true) (see DIMTP System Variable).

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.MinusTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum (or lower) tolerance limit for dimension text when or is on (true). (see DIMTM System Variable).

remarks.para: MinusTolerance accepts signed values. If is on and and MinusTolerance are set to the same value, a tolerance value is drawn.
If MinusTolerance and values differ, the upper tolerance is drawn above the lower, and a plus sign is added to the value if it is positive.
For MinusTolerance, the program uses the negative of the value you enter (adding a minus sign if you specify a positive number and a plus sign if you specify a negative number).

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.FixedExtensionLineLength
member.summary: Sets the total length of the extension lines starting from the dimension line toward the dimension origin (see DIMFXL System Variable).

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.JoggedRadiusDimensionTransverseSegmentAngle
member.summary: Determines the angle of the transverse segment of the dimension line in a jogged radius dimension in radians. (see DIMJOGANG System Variable).
member.value: Jogged radius dimensions are often created when the center point is located off the page. Valid settings range is 5 to 90 degrees.

member.summary: Controls the background of dimension text (see DIMTFILL System Variable).

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextBackgroundColor

member.summary: Specifies the height of dimension text, unless the current text style has a fixed height (see DIMTXT System Variable).

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.CenterMarkSize
member.summary: Controls drawing of circle or arc center marks and centerlines by the DIMCENTER, DIMDIAMETER, and DIMRADIUS commands (see DIMCEN System Variable).
member.remarks: For DIMDIAMETER and DIMRADIUS, the center mark is drawn only if you place the dimension line outside the circle or arc.

value.para: No center marks or lines are drawn

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.TickSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of oblique strokes drawn instead of arrowheads for linear, radius, and diameter dimensioning (see DIMTSZ System Variable).

value.para: Draws oblique strokes instead of arrowheads. The size of the oblique strokes is determined by this value multiplied by the value of .

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.AlternateUnitScaleFactor
member.summary: Controls the multiplier for alternate units (see DIMALTF System Variable).
member.remarks: If is turned on (true), the value of this property (AlternateUnitScaleFactor) multiplies linear dimensions by a factor to produce a value in an alternate system of measurement. The initial value represents the number of millimeters in an inch.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.LinearScaleFactor
member.summary: Sets a scale factor for linear dimension measurements (see DIMLFAC System Variable).

remarks.para: All linear dimension distances, including radii, diameters, and coordinates, are multiplied by this LinearScaleFactor before being converted to dimension text. Positive values of LinearScaleFactor are applied to dimensions in both model space and paper space; negative values are applied to paper space only.

LinearScaleFactor applies primarily to non-associative dimensions (DIMASSOC set 0 or 1). For non-associative dimensions in paper space, LinearScaleFactor must be set individually for each layout viewport to accommodate viewport scaling.
LinearScaleFactor has no effect on angular dimensions, and is not applied to the values held in , , or .

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextVerticalPosition
member.summary: Controls the vertical position of dimension text above or below the dimension line (see DIMTVP System Variable).
member.remarks: The TextVerticalPosition value is used when is off. The magnitude of the vertical offset of text is the product of the text height and TextVerticalPosition. Setting TextVerticalPosition to 1.0 is equivalent to setting to on. The dimension line splits to accommodate the text only if the absolute value of TextVerticalPosition is less than 0.7.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.ToleranceScaleFactor
member.summary: Specifies a scale factor for the text height of fractions and tolerance values relative to the dimension text height, as set by (see DIMTFAC System Variable).
member.remarks: For example, if ToleranceScaleFactor is set to 1.0, the text height of fractions and tolerances is the same height as the dimension text. If ToleranceScaleFactor is set to 0.7500, the text height of fractions and tolerances is three-quarters the size of dimension text.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimensionLineGap
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance around the dimension text when the dimension line breaks to accommodate dimension text (see DIMGAP System Variable).

remarks.para: Also sets the gap between annotation and a hook line created with the LEADER command. If you enter a negative value, DimensionLineGap places a box around the dimension text.

The value of DimensionLineGap is also used as the minimum length of each segment of the dimension line. To locate the components of a linear dimension within the extension lines, enough space must be available for both arrowheads (2 x ), both dimension line segments (2 x DimensionLineGap), a gap on either side of the dimension text (another 2 x DimensionLineGap), and the length of the dimension text, which depends on its size and number of decimal places displayed.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.AlternateUnitRounding
member.summary: Rounds off the alternate dimension units (see DIMALTRND System Variable).

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimensionLineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets colors to dimension lines, arrowheads, and dimension leader lines (see DIMCLRD System Variable).
member.remarks: Also controls the color of leader lines created with the LEADER command.

member.name: P:ACadSharp.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtensionLineColor
